General comment: What I was really after when I suggested a utility to convert from JSON to BIND zone file format was something that would do this for the service config JSON as described here:

https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/master/doc/service_config.md

For example, if you provide the following input:

```
[
  { 
    "percentage": 0, 
    "serviceConfig": {
      "loadBalancingPolicy": "round_robin",
      "methodConfig" : [
        { 
          "name": [
            { 
              "method": "Foo",
              "service": "NeverPickedService"
            }
          ],
          "waitForReady": true
        }
      ]
    }
  },
  {
    "percentage": 100,
    "serviceConfig": {
      "loadBalancingPolicy": "round_robin",
      "methodConfig": [
        {
          "name": [
            {
              "method": "Foo",
              "service": "AlwaysPickedService"
            }
          ],
          "waitForReady": true
        }
      ]
    }
  }
]
```

it should produce something like this, which are the lines that you would need to cut-and-paste into your zone file:

```
IN TXT (
  "grpc_config=[{\"percentage\":0,\"serviceConfig\":{\"loadBalancingPolicy\":\"round_robin\",\"methodConfig\":[{\"name\":[{\"method\":\"Foo\",\"service\":\"NeverPickedService\"}],\"waitForReady\":true}]}},{\"percentage\":100,\"serviceConfig\":{\"loadBalan"
  "cingPolicy\":\"round_robin\",\"methodConfig\":[{\"name\":[{\"method\":\"Foo\",\"service\":\"AlwaysPickedService\"}],\"waitForReady\":true}]}}]"
)
```

Can we refactor something out of this code that can do just that piece?  Thanks!

---

Review status: all files reviewed at latest revision, 6 unresolved discussions.

---

*[test/cpp/naming/convert_json_records_to_bind_zone_format.py, line 47 at r2](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/grpc/grpc/12942#-KwCQKa9B6HDKR4OZJLI:-KwCQKa9B6HDKR4OZJLJ:b-ya8pth) ([raw file](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/4debe40e42fc0da38b0ac9773b33321743b0acb7/test/cpp/naming/convert_json_records_to_bind_zone_format.py#L47)):*
> ```Python
>     next_chunk = ''
>     while len(next_chunk) < 255 and len(r_data[cur:]) > 0:
>       if r_data[cur] == '\"' and not args.python_dns_server_format:
> ```

I don't think you need a backslash inside of the single quotes.

---

*[test/cpp/naming/convert_json_records_to_bind_zone_format.py, line 52 at r2](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/grpc/grpc/12942#-KwCQXQ9O9nwFHgwkUgO:-KwCQXQ9O9nwFHgwkUgP:bfnfo7v) ([raw file](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/4debe40e42fc0da38b0ac9773b33321743b0acb7/test/cpp/naming/convert_json_records_to_bind_zone_format.py#L52)):*
> ```Python
>         # single-string 255 character limit. However, twisted BindAuthority
>         # requires that inner quotation marks are not escaped.
>         to_add = '\\\"'
> ```

I think this can just be '\\"'

---

*[test/cpp/naming/convert_json_records_to_bind_zone_format.py, line 73 at r2](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/grpc/grpc/12942#-KwCQqAzAZXL0zf5ruHi:-KwCQqAzAZXL0zf5ruHj:b-69s9yo) ([raw file](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/4debe40e42fc0da38b0ac9773b33321743b0acb7/test/cpp/naming/convert_json_records_to_bind_zone_format.py#L73)):*
> ```Python
>       # marks. But the "outer quotation marks" and "outer backslashes" are not counted
>       # towards the single-string 255 character limit.
>       c = '\"%s\"' % c.replace('\\\"', '\\\\\\\"')
> ```

This seems like way too many layers of backslashes.  You should only need one backslash before each quote in a zone file, like this:

```
foo.com. IN TXT (
  "grpc_config=[{\"serviceConfig\":{"
  "\"loadBalancingPolicy\":\"round_robin\"}}]"
)
```

The above works fine with bind.

---

>     # keyword and instead use FQDN in all names in the zone file, because older
>     # versions of twisted have a bug in which use of $ORIGIN adds an an extra
>     # period at the end of names in it's domain name lookup table. (see
> ```

Grammar nit: s/it's/its/

*[test/cpp/naming/gen_build_yaml.py, line 125 at r2](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/grpc/grpc/12942#-KwCRb4GTGBiH0AmRxat:-KwCRb4GTGBiH0AmRxau:b-ehwum) ([raw file](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/4debe40e42fc0da38b0ac9773b33321743b0acb7/test/cpp/naming/gen_build_yaml.py#L125)):*

>     resolver_component_data = yaml.load(f)
>   all_integration_test_records = _bind_convertable_json_form(resolver_component_data['resolver_component_tests'],
> ```

Please wrap lines at 80 columns.

---

*[test/cpp/naming/local_dns_server_records.json, line 53 at r2](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/grpc/grpc/12942#-KwCRuqs-ooDoyAxrfT-:-KwCRuqs-ooDoyAxrfT0:bezb0ah) ([raw file](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/4debe40e42fc0da38b0ac9773b33321743b0acb7/test/cpp/naming/local_dns_server_records.json#L53)):*
> ```JSON
>         }, 
>         {
>             "data": "grpc_config=[{\"serviceConfig\":{\"loadBalancingPolicy\":\"round_robin\",\"methodConfig\":[{\"name\":[{\"method\":\"Foo\",\"service\":\"SimpleService\",\"waitForReady\":true}]}]}}]", 
> ```

Most of these service config strings look invalid.  Note that the only two entries in the "name" block should be "service" and "method" -- I think you're accidentally including the "waitForReady" in the same block instead of after the "}]".

---


*Comments from [Reviewable](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/grpc/grpc/12942#-:-KwCLoltGZoCRAIb6a_Z:b-qhvi0v)*
<!-- Sent from Reviewable.io -->

> Can we refactor something out of this code that can do just that piece? Thanks!

Ok, this sounds good, I will probably restructure the top-level yaml file with the JSON strings to point files containing TXT-JSON in the form shown here, rather than compacted JSON strings, and then move the JSON -> TXT data conversion into it's own smaller script.

> This seems like way too many layers of backslashes.

FWIW, this appears to be just the way the gcloud DNS handles this. That is, after uploading a zone file to `gcloud dns` that contains this TXT record:

```
srv-ipv4-simple-service-config                                                                                                  2100    IN  TXT     (
     "grpc_config=[{\\\"serviceConfig\\\":{\\\"loadBalancingPolicy\\\":\\\"round_robin\\\",\\\"methodConfig\\\":[{\\\"name\\\":[{\\\"method\\\":\\\"Foo\\\",\\\"service\\\":\\\"SimpleService\\\",\\\"waitForReady\\\":true}]}]}}]"
 )
```

after resolving that TXT record, we get the intended JSON string:

```
grpc_config=[{"serviceConfig":{"loadBalancingPolicy":"round_robin","methodConfig":[{"name":[{"method":"Foo","service":"SimpleService","waitForReady":true}]}]}}]
```

This looks like it might be slightly unusual behavior for a zone file parser/uploader, but it seems to be the only way to get that JSON string stored.

thanks for comments! WIP in responding to the rest.

It seems very odd to me that GCE should use different quoting rules in their zone file uploads than most other DNS implementations.  Can you confirm with the GCE folks that this is intentional and not just a bug?  Thanks!

asking around...

Noting that the TXT quotation marks issue is a little strange.

For the same desired JSON string gotten from resolving a TXT record,

`gcloud` requires:

```
srv-ipv4-simple-service-config                                                                                                  2100    IN  TXT     (
     "grpc_config=[{\\\"serviceConfig\\\":{\\\"loadBalancingPolicy\\\":\\\"round_robin\\\",\\\"methodConfig\\\":[{\\\"name\\\":[{\\\"method\\\":\\\"Foo\\\",\\\"service\\\":\\\"SimpleService\\\",\\\"waitForReady\\\":true}]}]}}]"
 )
```

`bind9` requires:

```
srv-ipv4-simple-service-config                                                                                                  2100    IN  TXT     (
     "grpc_config=[{\"serviceConfig\":{\"loadBalancingPolicy\":\"round_robin\",\"methodConfig\":[{\"name\":[{\"method\":\"Foo\",\"service\":\"SimpleService\",\"waitForReady\":true}]}]}}]"
 )
```

and `twisted BindAuthority server` requires:

```
srv-ipv4-simple-service-config                                                                                                  2100    IN  TXT     (
     grpc_config=[{"serviceConfig":{"loadBalancingPolicy":"round_robin","methodConfig":[{"name":[{"method":"Foo","service":"SimpleService","waitForReady":true}]}]}}]
 )
```

not sure if `gcloud` can be compatible with `bind` somehow, but I think there needs to be at least some format switching.
